alert.note: Alert for Inyo; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 4:11PM PDT until August 01 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Inyo County in south central California... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 715 PM PDT. * At 411 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dumont Dunes, Tecopa and Sr 127 Near Dumont Dunes. This includes the following roads... State Route 127 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 12 and 41, Excelsior Mine Road, and Old Spanish Trail Highway. This includes the following streams and drainages... Lovell Wash and Amargosa River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
